article.headline: Bradley 73, Illinois State 44
article.story: PEORIA, Ill. (AP) -- Patrick O'Bryant scored 14 points and grabbed eight rebounds to lead Bradley over Illinois State 73-44 in a Missouri Valley Conference game Wednesday that started close but ended anything but. Illinois State (8-11, 3-8) contained the Braves until halftime, going into the break tied at 30-30. But the Redbirds scored just 14 points the rest of the way while Bradley (12-7, 6-5) put up 43. After shooting 50 percent in the first half, Illinois State dropped to 28 percent in the second. For the game, the Redbirds were 0-for-4 from the free-throw line and just 2-of-11 from 3-point range. Nedu Onyeuku led Redbirds scorers with 12 points. Khalif Ford scored 10 points and had five assists, while Greg Dilligard grabbed six rebounds. Lawrence Wright had 10 points and eight rebounds, Will Franklin scored 10 points and Daniel Ruffin dished six assists for the Braves.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
